title: Reinforcement Learning-Based Scientific Policy Design for Propellant Sloshing Control in Space Launch Vehicles

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in the relevant field or equivalent experience, proficiency in scientific inquiry methods and basic experimental design
context.additional_context: Provision of video lectures, interactive quizzes, and small-scale simulation tools optimized for smartphone-based learning environments. Learners enhance scientific observation and measurement skills through virtual lab environments simulating real-world spacecraft propulsion systems.

learning_goals: Learners will explain the scientific principles of reinforcement learning-based control policies and propose variable analysis and application strategies for propellant sloshing issues in space launch vehicles.

Learners will explain the mathematical definitions of CLF (Control Lyapunov Function) and CBF (Control Barrier Function) within one week, describe step-by-step stability verification procedures for three given control systems, implement two or more verification cases using simulation tools (e.g., MATLAB), and derive scientific evidence by analyzing experimental data.
Learners will perform safe propellant control simulations using DRL (Deep Reinforcement Learning) algorithms in mobile environments and draw conclusions based on experimental results.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
